Should we remove the filters row entirely while converting the filters to a multiselect dropdown?
image.png

Clicking on search button would expand it to show an input box. @Vlad Korobov FYI if you can help with the design.
Iâ€™m not sure I understand which filters and what is multi select dropdown

In the recent conversations view, the top filters, such as "Include Muted" and "Participated," are currently represented as individual pills. However, we are in the process of migrating them to a multi-select dropdown. This means that instead of having separate pills for each filter, there will be a single dropdown containing all the filter options.
I suggest to don't hide multi-select dropdown and make input field of such dropdown available and visible at all times, or I don't quite understand actual implementation of that
Ok, I will try to get proper screenshots for this once I start working on it.

Thanks Neil for bringing up insightful questions. We do need a different design for recent conversations filters. One that shows which stream is selected, has multi-select dropdown widget and a search bar.

We need to show full list of topics and to some extent participated information for them in recent conversation to even think about replacing the expanded topics list in the left sidebar.

I would suggest something like this as a step forward:

Screenshot-2023-08-03-at-8.46.51-PM.png

@Aman (amanagr) are you thinking we need that for stream recent conversations?

No.
But, I am thinking if you are using recent conversation and want to filter by stream, what should the design be like.
Or if we want to add more filters to recent topics like show resolved or unresolved, what should it look like...
Aman (amanagr) mentioned this topic in #design > recent conversations for streams.

Aman (amanagr) said:

But, I am thinking if you are using recent conversation and want to filter by stream, what should the design be like.

My clarification and suggestion here may be relevant: https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/recent.20conversations.20for.20streams/near/1619507

However, as it stands the current design for stream title changing to search filter text is not very clean (compared to pills?).
Yeah I think that searchbar approach is plausible! Or maybe something a bit different, but I think that wouldn't be super hard to do with our input pills?
